sentences.M1: A 20-year-old man wearing combat gear and armed with semiautomatic pistols and a semiautomatic rifle killed 26 people — 20 of them children — in an attack in an elementary school in central Connecticut on Friday.

assessment.overall assessment: The sentences are identical, resulting in no changes in meaning, sentiment, or importance.

sentences.M2: Reporting on the Connecticut shootings was contributed by Al Baker, Charles V. Bagli, Susan Beachy, Jack Begg, David W. Chen, Alison Leigh Cowan, Robert Davey, Matt Flegenheimer, Joseph Goldstein, Emmarie Huetteman, Kristin Hussey, Thomas Kaplan, Elizabeth Maker, Patrick McGeehan, Sheelagh McNeill, Michael Moss, Andy Newman, Richard Pérez-Peña, Jennifer Preston, William K. Rashbaum, Motoko Rich, Ray Rivera, Liz Robbins, Emily S. Rueb, Eric Schmitt, Michael Schwirtz, Kirk Semple, Wendy Ruderman, Jonathan Weisman, Vivian Yee and Kate Zernike.

assessment.overall importance of the change: Important - The addition of reporting credits provides attribution to the contributors.
assessment.importance reason: Attribution to multiple contributors enhances credibility and transparency in reporting.
assessment.literature rationale: Attribution in journalism is crucial for establishing credibility and accountability, as it allows readers to assess the reliability of the information presented.
assessment.version diff summary: M2 includes a list of contributors to the reporting.
assessment.overall assessment: The addition of reporting credits in M2 enhances the credibility of the article by providing clear attribution to multiple contributors, which is important for transparency in journalism.
